ARABIC: كَلَّا سَيَكْفُرُونَ بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ وَيَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضِدًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! They will reject their worship and will be opposed to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Never. They will deny their devotion and become their adversaries.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By no means! They shall soon deny their worship and shall become their adversaries instead.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In fact, they can have no honor; their gods will renounce their worship of idols and will turn against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Never; soon they will deny ever worshipping them, and will turn into their opponents.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and will become their adversaries.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: By no means! They shall soon deny their worshipping them, and they shall be adversaries to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No, indeed! They shall deny their service, and they shall be against them pitted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and become opponents unto them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But they shall reject their worship and turn against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! anon they shall deny their worship, and become unto them an adversary. *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No Indeed! Soon they will disown their worship, and they will be their opponents.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, but they (the so-called gods) will deny their worship of them, and become opponents to them (on the Day of Resurrection).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed no! They will renounce their worship and turn against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: By no means! They will reject their worship of them, and become opponents to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:82] Nay, that is to say, there is none to prevent their being chastised, but they, namely, the [idol] gods, shall reject their worship, that is, they will deny it — as [is stated] in another verse: It was not us that they used to worship [Q. 28:63]) — and they shall be [pitted] against them as opponents, enemies, supporting one another [against them].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, but they will deny their worship of them) i.e. the idols will absolve themselves from the disbelievers' worship of them, (and become) i.e. the idols (opponents unto them) a help in the torment of the disbelievers.
